page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO OUR AREA
page.content: Although the town of Ross-on-Wye has been split into two by the block all- ocation, a small background history was thought to be necessary.The Cel- tic name of Ross means 'a promontory' and alludes to the red sandstone cliff dominating the stretch of the Wye at this spot.In Norman times it was a man or of the Bishops of Hereford,whose palace occupied the site of the Royal Hotel.In l284 the Parish Church of St. Mary the Virgin was founded. Celebra- tions took place from Easter to Novem- ber l984 to commemorate the 'Ross 700 Festival'.The Market House was built of local red sandstone in 1670 & stan- ds on the site of the old Booth Hall. It is still used as the market place on Thursday & Saturday.The Hereford, Ross & Gloucester Railway was opened in l855 but closed in l964-the site is now developed as an industrial zone.
